Because the surface energy balance over land rapidly re-
equilibrates due to the low effective heat capacity of the land
is near zero for all land surfaces by necessity. The
is therefore calculated only over the
ocean, although the values are similar with and without land-
masking. The oceanic surface energy balance is not constrained to
re-equilibrate on atmosphere-only timescales, and as such will
ect the atmospheric conditions setting surface
can be construed as an intermediary between the TOA

response thereto, and is thus a telling manifestation of the fast,
ocean coupled response pattern formation. The annual-mean,

Similar atmospheric waves generated by land
The common pattern of surface heat
to each forcer is a manifestation of a wave perturbation to
the atmospheric circulation that is produced by both GHGs
and aerosols. Over the extratropical oceans, a barotropic
stationary Rossby wave perturbation to the atmospheric
consistent with the wave pattern in surface heat
